title: U.S. Looks for Progress on Trade at G-20, Markets Impatient on Trade Deal, The Addict Bank Robber
itunes:title: U.S. Looks for Progress on Trade at G-20, Markets Impatient on Trade Deal, The Addict Bank Robber
description:
Rui Zhong, Program Assistant at the Wilson Institute, and Bloomberg News Political Reporter Terrence Dopp, discuss whether Presidents Trump and Xi can come to an agreement on trade at the G-20 meeting. Wayne Wicker, Chief Investment Officer at Vantagepoint Investment Advisers, explains how to invest as trade tariffs continue to impact the markets. Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Freelance Writer Josh Dean tell the story of America's busiest bank robber who was a product of the opioid crisis. And we Drive to the Close with Shah Gilani, Editor at Capital Wave Forecast.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly.  Producer: Paul Brennan 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
